trans-unit.source: Used to group collections of controls.
A Panel is a control that contains other controls.
You can use a Panel to group collections of controls such as a group of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls.

As with other container controls such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control, if the Panel control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enabled%2A> property is set to `false`, the controls contained within the Panel will also be disabled.
The Panel control is displayed by default without any borders.
You can provide a standard or three-dimensional border using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel.BorderStyle%2A> property to distinguish the area of the panel from other areas on the form.

Because the Panel control derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl> class, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.AutoScroll%2A> property to enable scroll bars in the Panel control.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.AutoScroll%2A> property is set to `true`, any controls located within the Panel (but outside of its visible region), can be scrolled to with the scroll bars provided.
The Panel control does not display a caption.
If you need a control similar to a Panel that can display a caption, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Panel"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control resizes based on its contents.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control automatically resizes based on its contents; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel.AutoSize*> property has changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Indicates the automatic sizing behavior of the control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode"></xref> values.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode"></xref> values.
Indicates the border style for the control.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control is displayed without a border.
You can use this property to distinguish the boundaries of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control from other areas on the form.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_BorderStyle.None" name="BorderStyle.None" href=""></xref>.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle"></xref> value.
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
Gets the default size of the control.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the control.
This member is not meaningful for this control.
To be added.
This member is not meaningful for this control.
To be added.
This member is not meaningful for this control.
To be added.
Fires the event indicating that the panel has been resized.

Inheriting controls should use this in favor of actually listening to the event, but should still call <xref uid="langword_csharp_base.onResize" name="base.onResize" href=""></xref> to ensure that the event is fired for external listeners.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key.
When the user presses the TAB key, the input focus is set to the next control in the tab order.
Controls with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabStop%2A> property value of `false` are not included in the collection of controls in the tab order.
The tab order can be manipulated by setting the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabIndex%2A> property value.
> [!NOTE] > The TabStop property has no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control as it is a container object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user can give the focus to the control using the TAB key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This member is not meaningful for this control.
The text associated with this control.
This member is not meaningful for this control.
To be added.
Returns a string representation for this control.
A <xref:System.String> representation of the control.
